title: What causes panic attacks, and how can you prevent them? - Cindy J. Aaronson

options.label: A
options.text: To stimulate the parasympathetic nervous system

options.label: B
options.text: To release adrenaline and trigger the sympathetic nervous system

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the hormone released by the parasympathetic nervous system that helps to decrease the heart rate during a panic attack?
What is the main treatment for panic disorder that has a lasting effect, with only a 20% relapse rate?
What is the goal of the cognitive restructuring stage of CBT treatment for panic disorder?

options.label: A
options.text: To identify and change the thoughts that are common during attacks

options.label: B
options.text: To expose the person to the bodily sensations and situations that typically trigger a panic attack

options.label: C
options.text: To help the person consciously control breathing patterns

options.label: D
options.text: To provide a detailed explanation of the physiological causes of a panic attack

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary cause of a panic attack, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: An overreaction to the body's normal physiological response to the perception of danger

multiple-choice.question: What is the approximate percentage of people who will experience at least one panic attack in their lives?
What is the name of the brain region involved in processing fear, which stimulates the sympathetic nervous system during a panic attack?
What is the primary function of the prefrontal cortex during a panic attack?

options.label: A
options.text: To stimulate the sympathetic nervous system

options.label: C
options.text: To take over from the amygdala and stimulate the parasympathetic nervous system

multiple-choice.question: What is the main treatment for panic disorder that carries some side effects and has a 50% relapse rate when stopped?
What is the primary goal of CBT treatment for panic disorder?

options.label: A
options.text: To provide a detailed explanation of the physiological causes of a panic attack

options.label: B
options.text: To help people learn and practice concrete tools to exert physical and mental control over the sensations and thoughts associated with a panic attack

options.label: C
options.text: To expose the person to the bodily sensations and situations that typically trigger a panic attack

options.label: D
options.text: To change the person's behavior and avoid panic attacks

title: The myth of Anansi, the trickster spider - Emily Zobel Marshall

multiple-choice.question: Who is the all-seeing Sky God in the story?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: To tell the stories to the people on Earth

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: To complete an impossible task set by Nyame

options.label: D

title: How stretching actually changes your muscles - Malachy McHugh

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary purpose of stretching before physical activity?

options.label: D
options.text: To prevent injuries and improve flexibility

multiple-choice.question: What type of stretching involves controlled movements that engage a range of muscles throughout the motion?

What is a potential risk of stretching too much?
How long do the benefits of stretching last without further activity?

What is the recommended frequency of stretching to improve flexibility?
What is a potential benefit of long-term improvements to flexibility?

options.label: C
options.text: Better range of motion for joints

options.label: B
options.text: The ability of muscle to change under the stress of being stretched

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: C
options.text: Better range of motion for joints
